meanings.definition: To harm or be detrimental to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Yelling at your friend can be disserving to your relationship.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing sunscreen on a sunny day can be disserving to your skin.
meanings.sent3: Eating ice cream for breakfast might be disserving to your health.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs could disserving your safety.
meanings.sent5: Skipping meals regularly can disserving your overall well-being.

meanings.definition: Acting in a way that is not in someone's best interest.
meanings.sent1: His disserving behavior led to misunderstandings among friends.
meanings.sent2: The disserving decision made by the coach affected the team's performance.
meanings.sent3: Wearing mismatched socks to a job interview was disserving.
meanings.sent4: The old, disserving habits were hard to break.
meanings.sent5: Her disserving attitude towards learning hindered her progress in school.
